sentence.Network_en: Tiredness can seriously impair your ability to drive.
sentence.Network_cn: 疲劳会大大影响你的驾驶能力.

sentence.Network_en: It can not impair the intellectual vigor of the young.
sentence.Network_cn: 这不能磨灭青年人思想活力.

sentence.Network_en: The author's half drunken state did not in the least impair his eminence in my eyes.
sentence.Network_cn: 在我的眼里,这位作家的醺醺醉态丝毫无损他的高尚.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English enpeire, from Old French empeirier, based on late Latin pejorare (from Latin pejor 'worse'). The current spelling is due to association with words derived from Latin beginning with im-

entry.def: If something impairs something such as an ability or the way something works, it damages it or makes it worse.

example.ex: Consumption of alcohol impairs your ability to drive a car or operate machinery...
example.tran: 饮酒会削弱你驾驶汽车或操控机器的能力。

example.ex: His movements were painfully impaired by arthritis.
example.tran: 他行动不便，深受关节炎之苦。

auth_sentence.content: This would really impair the election, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content: This would really impair the election, she said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This would really impair the election, she said.

auth_sentence.content: Its colours mellow'd, not impair'd, by time.
auth_sentence.res_content: Its colours mellow'd, not impair'd, by time.

auth_sentence.content: Being toothless did not impair one's capacity to eat army food.
auth_sentence.res_content: Being toothless did not impair one's capacity to eat army food.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Being toothless did not impair one's capacity to eat army food.

sentences.cn: 吸烟会损害我们的健康。

jushi.english: His hearing was impaired after the explosion.
jushi.chinese: 那次爆炸之后,他的听力受到了损害。
